bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The New York Congregational Home for the Aged was incorporated in 1910, and was funded by the Brooklyn-Manhattan Conference of Congregational Churches. Located in Brooklyn, the Home provided care and housing for elderly men and women affiliated with the Congregational denomination within Conference limits. Its original location was 125-127 Gates Avenue, but by 1917 it had relocated to 123 Linden Avenue. As of 2010, the Home continues to serve elderly members of the Congregational parish at 135 Linden Boulevard.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The New York Congregational Home for the Aged annual reports span the period 1910 to 1925. The reports are compiled in two bound volumes and feature extensive summary information on the Home, including listings and directories of officers, directors, managers, committees, and auxiliaries; lists of the Home's inhabitants (including the churches they came from, dates of admittance, and remarks on whether the resident left the home or passed away during the reviewed year); minutes of annual meetings; reports of directors, managers, physicians, and auxiliaries; financial statements and summaries of donations; lists of members and contributors from each of the Home's member churches; and the Home's certificate of incorporation, bylaws, and rules and regulations. Also included is a separate publication containing the Home's certificate of incorporation, bylaws, and rules.
